description: Foundational physics problems with step-by-step solutions covering all Grade 9 topics. Build a strong understanding of fundamental physics concepts through practice.

topics.name: Unit 1: Scientific Method
topics.description: Scientific inquiry, hypothesis testing, experimental design, variables, and data analysis

topics.name: Unit 2: Measurement
topics.description: SI units, unit conversions, significant figures, scientific notation, and measurement tools

topics.name: Unit 3: Motion & Graphs
topics.description: Distance, displacement, speed, velocity, acceleration, and motion graphs

topics.name: Unit 4: Forces
topics.description: Types of forces, Newton's laws, balanced and unbalanced forces, friction, and weight

topics.name: Unit 5: Energy & Power
topics.description: Forms of energy, energy transformations, work, power, and efficiency

topics.name: Unit 6: Circular Motion
topics.description: Centripetal force, circular motion basics, speed in circular paths, and applications

topics.name: Unit 7: Heat & Temperature
topics.description: Temperature scales, thermal expansion, heat transfer (conduction, convection, radiation), and specific heat

topics.name: Unit 8: Waves & Sound
topics.description: Wave properties, types of waves, sound waves, frequency, wavelength, amplitude, and the Doppler effect

topics.name: Unit 9: Light & Reflection
topics.description: Properties of light, reflection, mirrors (plane, concave, convex), ray diagrams, and image formation

topics.name: Unit 10: Electricity
topics.description: Static electricity, current electricity, Ohm's law, circuits (series and parallel), and electrical safety
